meanings.definition: A person who studies the structure and constitution of metals.
meanings.sent1: The metallographers examined the patterns in the steel under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The team of metallographers conducted experiments to understand the properties of different metals.
meanings.sent3: The metallographers joked that they could read the 'metal language' of alloys.
meanings.sent4: The metallographers were like detectives, uncovering the secrets hidden within the metal's structure.
meanings.sent5: The work of metallographers is crucial for improving the quality of metal products.

meanings.definition: Those who analyze the physical and chemical properties of metals.
meanings.sent1: The metallographers tested the hardness of the metal samples in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Metallographers use advanced tools to analyze the composition of different metals.
meanings.sent3: The metallographers were amazed by the unique properties of the rare metal they studied.
meanings.sent4: To the metallographers, each metal sample was a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The precision of metallographers ensures the reliability of their findings on metal properties.

meanings.definition: Individuals who conduct research on the microstructure of metals.
meanings.sent1: The metallographers investigated the tiny grains within the metal samples.
meanings.sent2: Metallographers explore the intricate details of metal structures to gain insights.
meanings.sent3: The metallographers were fascinated by the miniature world they observed through their microscopes.
meanings.sent4: In the hands of metallographers, metals reveal their hidden beauty at a microscopic level.
meanings.sent5: The dedication of metallographers leads to breakthroughs in understanding metal microstructures.
